title: Personal website
text:
Hello,I am shao xuan making this website for AAI1001 Assignment This is my 2nd year in SIT.

1 + 1

[1] 2

title: Payment Project
text:
This project is about designing and developing a complete order and redeem rewards application. This system allows users to accumulate points by engaging in volunteer activities, and they can use the points to place orders of food and beverage (F&B) in merchants on campus. Our solution was a mobile app and a web page. The mobile app comprises NETS QR payment option, and NETS Click mobile payment simulators along with several APIs like F&B merchants and volunteer charities to provide a smooth user experience. The web page contains an analytics dashboard for users. The project has three distinct segments: a Flutter-programmed mobile app where volunteers can keep track and use rewards; ties with the NETS payment APIs to make test purchases; and a web-based analytics dashboard in which to observe trends in F&B purchases and volunteer activities. The solution contributes to the efficiency of the process of food ordering on campus and redemption of reward points. It enables us students, to obtain skillsets that are important in FinTech and the digital industry in Singapore.

This was a Figma prototype for the mobile application interface.

title: Datavis
text: This page showcases a couple of data visualisations from my project.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:
Throughout my time in Uni. GenAI has been a huge help to me. As it is incredibly accessible to everyone. but due to that accessibility i fear that i am relying on it too much. using it too much when i encounter a simple problem.
I have been using it to help me study and sometimes asking it to generate questions for me to test knowledge on if there are no mock tests available one the Xsite.

title: Datavis

Graph 2: Volunteer Registrations

This graph displays the number of volunteers that have registered for that charity’s activity.

title: Datavis
text:
Reflection
i think this was the best way that i had to visualize these data at the time. These visualizations turn our system’s transactional and volunteering data into actionable insights. They are developed through SQL data aggregation on the backend and dynamic javascript on the frontend, enhancing the user experience, thus making the trends page an integral feature for the website.
